intro: Parthenium amplectens, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster at the end of each stem. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
